org.daisy.dotify.common.layout

Class SplitPointHandler<T extends SplitPointUnit>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.dotify.common.layout.SplitPointHandler<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of split point units

    public class SplitPointHandler<T extends SplitPointUnit>
extends Object
    Breaks units into results. All allowed break points are supplied with the input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SplitPointHandler()
      Creates a new split point handler.

    • Method Detail

      • split

        @SafeVarargs
public final SplitPoint<T> split(float breakPoint,
                                              boolean force,
                                              T... units)
        Splits the data at, or before, the supplied breakPoint according to the rules in the data. If force is used, rules may be broken to achieve a result.
        Parameters:
        breakPoint - the split point
        force - true if force is allowed, false otherwise
        units - the data
        Returns:
        returns a split point result

      • split

        public SplitPoint<T> split(float breakPoint,
                           boolean force,
                           List<T> units)
        Splits the data at, or before, the supplied breakPoint according to the rules in the data. If force is used, rules may be broken to achieve a result.
        Parameters:
        breakPoint - the split point
        force - true if force is allowed, false otherwise
        units - the data
        Returns:
        returns a split point result

      • split

        public SplitPoint<T> split(float breakPoint,
                           boolean force,
                           SplitPointData<T> data)
        Splits the data at, or before, the supplied breakPoint according to the rules in the data. If force is used, rules may be broken to achieve a result.
        Parameters:
        breakPoint - the split point
        force - true if force is allowed, false otherwise
        data - the data to split
        Returns:
        returns a split point result

      • isTrimTrailing

        public boolean isTrimTrailing()
        Returns true if trailing skippable units will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if trailing skippable units will be removed, false otherwise

      • setTrimTrailing

        public void setTrimTrailing(boolean trimTrailing)
        Sets whether to trim trailing skippable units or not.
        Parameters:
        trimTrailing - the new value

      • getCost

        public SplitPointCost<T> getCost()
        Gets the cost function
        Returns:
        returns the cost function

      • setCost

        public void setCost(SplitPointCost<T> cost)

        Sets the cost function used when determining the optimal forced split point.

        Note that the cost function is only used if there are no breakable units available.

        Parameters:
        cost - the cost function
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cost is null

      • trimLeading

        public static <T extends SplitPointUnit> SplitList<T> trimLeading(List<T> in)
        Trims leading skippable units in the supplied list. The result is backed by the original list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of split list
        Parameters:
        in - the list to trim
        Returns:
        the list split in two parts, one with the leading skippable units, one with the remainder
